704930f-a.text:
Hicks Street, east side, from Montague to Pierrepont Streets, showing the Pierrepont house at the corner owned by C.W. Reed in 1889. The Fier-pont, a 6-story structure, occupies the site in 1929.
About 1890.
Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.
704930f-a.folder: Hicks Street & Montague Street, Brooklyn, NY

705760f.text:
()
Montague Street, at the S.E. corner of Hicks Street, showing Miss Whitcomb's "Young Ladies Seminary', adjoining home of John A. Latimer. Both
were raned to make way for the Bossert Hotel.
1915.
Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.
(2)
The same, another view.
1915.
Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.
705760f.folder: Montague Street & Hicks Street, Brooklyn, NY

704931f-a.text:
Hicks Street, at the N.W. corner of Montague Street, showing the Gilkison Swiss Cottage, razed before 1929; since then an 8-story building has
occupied the site.
1920.
Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.
704931f-a.folder: Hicks Street & Montague Street, Brooklyn, NY
